trans-unit.source: How to use Notification Hubs with Python
trans-unit.target: How to use Notification Hubs with Python

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure Notification Hubs from a Python back-end.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure Notification Hubs from a Python back-end.

trans-unit.source: How to use Notification Hubs from Python
trans-unit.target: How to use Notification Hubs from Python

trans-unit.source: You can access all Notification Hubs features from a Java/PHP/Python/Ruby back-end using the Notification Hub REST interface as described in the MSDN topic <link><linkText>Notification Hubs REST APIs</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You can access all Notification Hubs features from a Java/PHP/Python/Ruby back-end using the Notification Hub REST interface as described in the MSDN topic <link><linkText>Notification Hubs REST APIs</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: This is a sample reference implementation for implementing the notification sends in Python and is not the officially supported Notifications Hub Python SDK.
trans-unit.target: This is a sample reference implementation for implementing the notification sends in Python and is not the officially supported Notifications Hub Python SDK.

trans-unit.source: This sample is written using Python 3.4.
trans-unit.target: This sample is written using Python 3.4.

trans-unit.source: In this topic we show how to:
trans-unit.target: In this topic we show how to:

trans-unit.source: Build a REST client for Notification Hubs features in Python.
trans-unit.target: Build a REST client for Notification Hubs features in Python.

trans-unit.source: Send notifications using the Python interface to the Notification Hub REST APIs.
trans-unit.target: Send notifications using the Python interface to the Notification Hub REST APIs.

trans-unit.source: Get a dump of the HTTP REST request/response for debugging/educational purpose.
trans-unit.target: Get a dump of the HTTP REST request/response for debugging/educational purpose.

trans-unit.source: You can follow the <link><linkText>Get started tutorial</linkText><title></title></link> for your mobile platform of choice, implementing the back-end portion in Python.
trans-unit.target: You can follow the <link><linkText>Get started tutorial</linkText><title></title></link> for your mobile platform of choice, implementing the back-end portion in Python.

trans-unit.source: The scope of the sample is only limited to send notifications and it doesn't do any registration management.
trans-unit.target: The scope of the sample is only limited to send notifications and it doesn't do any registration management.

trans-unit.source: Client interface
trans-unit.target: Client interface

trans-unit.source: The main client interface can provide the same methods that are available in the <link><linkText>.NET Notification Hubs SDK</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The main client interface can provide the same methods that are available in the <link><linkText>.NET Notification Hubs SDK</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: This will allow you to directly translate all the tutorials and samples currently available on this site, and contributed by the community on the internet.
trans-unit.target: This will allow you to directly translate all the tutorials and samples currently available on this site, and contributed by the community on the internet.

trans-unit.source: You can find all the code available in the [Python REST wrapper sample].
trans-unit.target: You can find all the code available in the [Python REST wrapper sample].

trans-unit.source: Implementation
trans-unit.target: Implementation

trans-unit.source: If you did not already, please follow our [Get started tutorial] up to the last section where you have to implement the back-end.
trans-unit.target: If you did not already, please follow our [Get started tutorial] up to the last section where you have to implement the back-end.

trans-unit.source: All the details to implement a full REST wrapper can be found on <link><linkText>MSDN</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: All the details to implement a full REST wrapper can be found on <link><linkText>MSDN</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In this section we will describe the Python implementation of the main steps required to access Notification Hubs REST endpoints and send notifications
trans-unit.target: In this section we will describe the Python implementation of the main steps required to access Notification Hubs REST endpoints and send notifications

trans-unit.target: Parse the connection string

trans-unit.source: Generate the authorization token
trans-unit.target: Generate the authorization token

trans-unit.target: Send a notification using HTTP REST API

trans-unit.target: Parse the connection string

trans-unit.target: Here is the main class implementing the client, whose constructor parses the connection string:

trans-unit.source: Create security token
trans-unit.target: Create security token

trans-unit.source: The details of the security token creation are available <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The details of the security token creation are available <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The following methods have to be added to the NotificationHub class to create the token based on the URI of the current request and the credentials extracted from the connection string.
trans-unit.target: The following methods have to be added to the NotificationHub class to create the token based on the URI of the current request and the credentials extracted from the connection string.

trans-unit.source: Send a notification using HTTP REST API
trans-unit.target: Send a notification using HTTP REST API

trans-unit.source: First, let use define a class representing a notification.
trans-unit.target: First, let use define a class representing a notification.

trans-unit.source: This class is a container for a native notification body or a set of properties in case of a template notification, a set of headers which contains format (native platform or template) and platform-specific properties (like Apple expiration property and WNS headers).
trans-unit.target: This class is a container for a native notification body or a set of properties in case of a template notification, a set of headers which contains format (native platform or template) and platform-specific properties (like Apple expiration property and WNS headers).

trans-unit.source: Please refer to the <link><linkText>Notification Hubs REST APIs documentation</linkText><title></title></link> and the specific notification platforms' formats for all the options available.
trans-unit.target: Please refer to the <link><linkText>Notification Hubs REST APIs documentation</linkText><title></title></link> and the specific notification platforms' formats for all the options available.

trans-unit.source: Now with this class, we can write the send notification methods inside of the NotificationHub class.
trans-unit.target: Now with this class, we can write the send notification methods inside of the NotificationHub class.

trans-unit.source: The above methods send an HTTP POST request to the /messages endpoint of your notification hub, with the correct body and headers to send the notification.
trans-unit.target: The above methods send an HTTP POST request to the /messages endpoint of your notification hub, with the correct body and headers to send the notification.

trans-unit.source: Using debug property to enable detailed logging
trans-unit.target: Using debug property to enable detailed logging

trans-unit.source: Enabling debug property while initializing the Notification Hub will write out detailed logging information about the HTTP request and response dump as well as detailed Notification message send outcome.
trans-unit.target: Enabling debug property while initializing the Notification Hub will write out detailed logging information about the HTTP request and response dump as well as detailed Notification message send outcome.

trans-unit.source: We recently added this property called <link><linkText>Notification Hubs TestSend property</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: We recently added this property called <link><linkText>Notification Hubs TestSend property</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: which returns detailed information about the notification send outcome.
trans-unit.target: which returns detailed information about the notification send outcome.

trans-unit.source: The Notification Hub Send request HTTP URL gets appended with a "test" querystring as a result.
trans-unit.target: The Notification Hub Send request HTTP URL gets appended with a "test" querystring as a result.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Complete the tutorial
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Complete the tutorial

trans-unit.source: Now you can complete the Get Started tutorial by sending the notification from a Python back-end.
trans-unit.target: Now you can complete the Get Started tutorial by sending the notification from a Python back-end.

trans-unit.source: Initialize your Notification Hubs client (substitute the connection string and hub name as instructed in the [Get started tutorial]):
trans-unit.target: Initialize your Notification Hubs client (substitute the connection string and hub name as instructed in the [Get started tutorial]):

trans-unit.source: Then add the send code depending on your target mobile platform.
trans-unit.target: Then add the send code depending on your target mobile platform.

trans-unit.source: This sample also adds higher level methods to enable sending notifications based on the platform e.g. send_windows_notification for windows; send_apple_notification (for apple) etc.
trans-unit.target: This sample also adds higher level methods to enable sending notifications based on the platform e.g. send_windows_notification for windows; send_apple_notification (for apple) etc.

trans-unit.target: Running your Python code should produce a notification appearing on your target device.

trans-unit.source: Enabling debug property
trans-unit.target: Enabling debug property

trans-unit.source: When you enable debug flag while initializing the NotificationHub then you will see detailed HTTP request and response dump as well as NotificationOutcome like the following where you can understand what HTTP headers are passed in the request and what HTTP response was received from the Notification Hub:
trans-unit.target: When you enable debug flag while initializing the NotificationHub then you will see detailed HTTP request and response dump as well as NotificationOutcome like the following where you can understand what HTTP headers are passed in the request and what HTTP response was received from the Notification Hub:

trans-unit.source: You will see detailed Notification Hub result e.g.
trans-unit.target: You will see detailed Notification Hub result e.g.

trans-unit.source: when the message is successfully sent to the Push Notification Service.
trans-unit.target: when the message is successfully sent to the Push Notification Service.

trans-unit.source: If there were no targets found for any push notification then you are likely going to see the following in the response (which indicates that there were no registrations found to deliver the notification probably because the registrations had some mismatched tags)
trans-unit.target: If there were no targets found for any push notification then you are likely going to see the following in the response (which indicates that there were no registrations found to deliver the notification probably because the registrations had some mismatched tags)

trans-unit.source: Broadcast toast notification to Windows
trans-unit.target: Broadcast toast notification to Windows

trans-unit.source: Notice the headers that get sent out when you are sending a broadcast toast notification to Windows client.
trans-unit.target: Notice the headers that get sent out when you are sending a broadcast toast notification to Windows client.

trans-unit.source: Send notification specifying a tag (or tag expression)
trans-unit.target: Send notification specifying a tag (or tag expression)

trans-unit.source: Notice the Tags HTTP header which gets added to the HTTP request (in the example below, we are sending the notification only to registrations with 'sports' payload)
trans-unit.target: Notice the Tags HTTP header which gets added to the HTTP request (in the example below, we are sending the notification only to registrations with 'sports' payload)

trans-unit.source: Send notification specifying multiple tags
trans-unit.target: Send notification specifying multiple tags

trans-unit.source: Notice how the Tags HTTP header changes when multiple tags are sent.
trans-unit.target: Notice how the Tags HTTP header changes when multiple tags are sent.
